author: Staff Reporter
text:
Ahead of ‘Masi Thiruvizha,’ scheduled to commence at Arulmigu Subramaniyaswamy Temple, the second abode of Lord Murugan, in Tiruchendur, a meeting involving officials of various departments was convened here on Tuesday.

During the meeting, presided over by Collector M. Ravikumar, preparatory measures for the conduct of the festival were discussed.

The twelve-day festival would commence with flag hoisting on February 13 and around five lakh devotees from various parts of the State were expected to throng Tiruchendur to witness the festival, the Collector said. Hence, the Collector appealed to the officials to ensure all necessary facilities including drinking water, uninterrupted power supply and public hygiene were in place in the interest of the devotees.

Moreover, emergency medical care providers should be stationed on the temple premises round-the-clock during the festival. The seashore in Tiruchendur should be under surveillance with deployment of personnel to prevent any untoward incident. Fisheries Department personnel along with Fire and Rescue services personnel should be engaged in monitoring the seashore and act in case of any eventuality.

S. Gopala Sundara Raj, Tuticorin Sub Collector, Thyagarajan, Tiruchendur Revenue Divisional Officer and officials from Tiruchendur temple were present.
title: Masi Tiruvizha: meeting convened
